entry.title: Chern-Schwartz-MacPherson Class of Determinantal Varieties
entry.summary: For $m\geq n$, let $\tau_{m,n,k}$ be the set of $m\times n$ matrices with kernel dimension $\ge k$. It is viewed as a subvariety of the projective space $\mathbb{P}^{mn-1}$ of nonzero $m\times n$ matrices up to scalar. In most cases $\tau_{m,n,k}$ is singular, and its singular locus is $\tau_{m,n,k+1}$. In this note we compute its Chern-Schwartz-MacPherson class $c_{SM}(\tau_{m,n,k})$ by using a resolution of singularities $\nu\colon \hat\tau_{m,n,k}\to \tau_{m,n,k} $, which may also be realized as a projective bundle over a Grassmannian. By the functoriality of $c_{SM}$ class, we can relate $c_{SM}(\tau_{m,n,k})$ to the pushforward $\nu_*c_{SM}(\hat \tau_{m,n,k})$, and the Grassmanian plays an important role in the computation. Our formula can be easily implemented in Macaulay2. On the basis of explicit computations in low dimension, we formulate conjectures concerning the effectivity of the classes and the vanishing of specific terms in the $c_{SM}$ classes of the nonsingular part of the loci $\tau_{m,n,k}$.
